resources.string: ARK Invest, an investment management company focused solely on disruptive innovation, has done a lot of research on the foundational innovations that will shape our world in the next few decades.

ARK Invest, an investment management company focused solely on disruptive innovation, has done a lot of research on the foundational innovations that will shape our world in the next few decades. They refer to these foundational and disruptive innovations as innovation platforms. While information technology and the ARK has identified five innovation platforms that they driving costs down, creating huge demand growth across virtually all sectors and geographies.
A program under ASIST - Augmented Social Innovations through Science and Technology

Empower and encourage the engineering minds to work for the social cause through: 
- Organising Competitions for young engineering graduates, engineering students and school students in the themes aligned with the vision. 
- Recognising the engineering educators for their service to the society 
- Creating a strong network for mentors and mentees from industry and academia. 
- Encouraging Interdisciplinary work in creating solutions for social issues.
To instill social responsibility and ethics as a continuing education in the young minds through activities and encourage service oriented engineering practice.

Innovation Challenge is an international project competition established by IEEE Madras Section and IEEE Education Society to encourage the participants to come up with innovative ideas for the social and humanitarian issues. Here YESIST12 acts as a platform to bridge the gap between the engineers and visonaries to contribute to the society with innovations.\n\nThis exceptional platform conducts competition in two stages. The preliminary stage is conducted across Asian and African countries and the team that tops the round wins a chance to compete globally to address humanitarian and social issues like poverty, famine, special needs, women safety, healthcare, disaster management, and many more.

1. Novelty
2. Clarity
3. Feasibility and Practicability
4. User Experience
5. Scale of impact
6. Sustainability
7. Potential for future work progression.

1. Under the Innovation Challenge theme, the projects can be Mobile Apps or Computer Based or IoT based. 

2. In addition to developing the projects, the developers should ensure that their creation follows the international industry level technical standards set by the various agencies and approved universally. The evaluation criteria will be as follows: 
a. Creativity 
b. Application 
c. Relevance to the theme 
d. Application of Standards 
e. Deliverability 

3. Students with drive and passion towards helping humanity are invited to register for the competition. The first round of the competition is to be held all over Asia in the pilots selected on the basis of registration. The winning teams will be called for the final round to be organised in September 2021.

1. Registration of Pilot Institutions closes: April 25, 2021 
2. Registration of Teams with Pilot Institution closes: As indicated by the Pilot 
3. Date for Preliminary to be conducted by Pilot Institution: March 2021 to July 2021 
4. Finals and Conference: September 2021

1. Call for abstracts: To Be Updated 
2. Intimation to selected teams & Registration: To Be Updated 
3. Registration closes: To Be Updated 
4. Finals and Conference: September 2021
Registration Fee for the final round: To be Updated

1. Prize Money will be announce later. 
2. Vibrant Pilot Awards 
3. Training Opportunities 
4. Certificates will be provided for the participants

MakerFair is a unique platform with opportunities for the innovators, makers, and creators to showcase their marvelous products to the international community. Teams with enthusiasm and determination of inventing and showcasing their innovative ideas which are capable from ideation to commercialization are invited to register for this event. \n\nIn 2021, MakerFair Track have goals to achieve maximum goals which can be helpful to the world regarding the problems World has been facing in recent times under the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level

1. Team size: Maximum of 4 members. 
2. Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. Only the registered members of the team will be given certificates. Mentor names should also accompany the team registration. 
3. Teams shall display their working projects in the venue, explain and demonstrate to the audience and evaluators. 
4. The evaluation will be based on the following criteria: Challenge, Innovation, Usability, and Extendibility. 
5. Teams are locked along with abstract submission, and no further changes to team membership and mentors can be made after that. 
6. Each team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork.

1. Call for Abstracts: May 1, 2021 
2. Last Date for Abstract Submission: May 31, 2021 
3. Notification of Acceptance: June 1, 2021 
4. Registration to the finals: August 15, 2021
Registration Fee for the final round: To be Updated
1. Prize Money will be announce later. \n2. Certificates will be provided for the participants

Junior Einstein Track acts as a catalyst for innovation and provides a transformative opportunity to broaden the horizon of knowledge among the young curious minds. This event makes effort to harness the creative submissions and innovative spirit towards Scientific and technological ideas/innovations from the school students of age 12 to 17 and to get rooted as one of the foremost project competition in the global arena developing a robust scientific temper among the youth.\n

1. Team size: Maximum of 4 members. 
2. Participant’s Age: 12 to 17 years. Proof for the same shall be submitted. (Bonafide letter from school or birth certificate) 
3. Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. Only the registered members of the team will be given certificates. Mentor names should also accompany the team registration. 
4. Teams are locked along with abstract submission and no further changes to team members and mentors can be made thereafter. 
5. Teams shall present their working projects in the virtually, explain and demonstrate to the audience and evaluators. 
6. The evaluation will be based on the following criteria: Novelty / Innovation, Participant’s knowledge on concept / market demand, Technical implementation, Expandability of the project idea/prototype to an actual product or solution, Clarity of pitch. 
7. Plagiarism at any forms or at any stage is strictly prohibited. 
8. Each team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork. 

The projects can be a software solution or hardware integrated.

1. Novelty
2. Clarity
3. Feasibility and Practicability
4. User Experience
5. Scale of impact
6. Sustainability
7. Potential for future work progression.

1. Registration of Pilot Institutions closes: May 31, 2021 
2. Date for Preliminary to be conducted by Pilot Institution: As indicated by Pilot 
3. Completion of Preliminary round by Pilots (To Be Updated) 
4. Registration of Teams with Pilot Institution closes: As indicated by the Pilot 
5. Finals and Conference: September 2021

1. Call for abstracts: May 11, 2021 
2. Intimation to selected teams & Registration: To Be Updated 
3. Registration closes: June 15, 2021 
4. Finals and Conference: September 2021
Registration Fee for the final round: To be Updated

1. Prize Money will be announce later. 
2. Vibrant Pilot Awards 
3. Training Opportunities 
4. Certificates will be provided for the participants

The World Bank recently started “South Asia Gender and Energy” (SAGE) initiative with a plan to establish a “Women in Power Sector Network in South Asia (WePOWER)” to promote women engineers and practitioners in the energy and power sector, and bring normative change regarding women in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) education. 

The example of the value propositions are: 
-Capacity building 
-Networking and mentorship for women engineers for career advancement 
-Exposure to technology and utility/energy sector in developed countries 
-Access to information and conferences 
-Recruitment opportunities 
-Exposure and encouragement to women students to pursue energy sector engineering jobs as a viable career option 

WePOWER topics: 
-Renewable Energy 
-Energy Conservation and Management 
-Energy Auditing 
-Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution 
-Flexible AC Transmissions System (FACTS) 
-IoT in Energy and Smart Grid 
-Digitalization(AI, ML, Computing) in Renewable Energy 
-Smart Technologies in Electrical Power Sector Network

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level

1. Team size: Maximum of 4 members (at least one girl). 
2. Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. 
3. Teams are locked along with abstract submission, and no further changes to team membership and mentors can be made after that. 
4. Working model (hardware), simulation works, research studies and idea proposition are all accepted during the finals. However the technical content should be strong and sufficient literature review has to be done (and everything should be mentioned in the abstract also). Proposed area should be innovative and should have positive potential impact. 
5. Each Team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork.

1. Call for Abstracts: May 1, 2021 
2. Last Date for Abstract Submission: May 31, 2021 
3. Notification of Acceptance: June 15, 2021 
4. Registration to the finals: August 15, 2021
Registration Fee for the final round: To be Updated
1. Prize Money will be announce later. \n2. Certificates will be provided for the participants

Special Track aims at bringing out the innovative solutions to solve issues of mankind, on a global scale. It is the recently added track in YESIST12 during its 2020 edition and focussed on health and disaster management. In 2021, Special Track targets on providing solutions to more challenges faced by every individual on the planet. Novel ideas, creative proposals with interesting presentations are rewarded and appreciated. 

The submissions could be related to the following topics: 
-Clean water and Sanitation. 
-Improvised medical and health care. 
-Sustainable cities and communities. 
-Preventive measures from hazards and disasters. 
-Environmental Engineering.

1. The team size is from 2 to 4 members. 
2. A team may comprise members from varied academic institutions/ Industries and maybe from different countries. 
3. People who enroll themselves along with team member's registration along with the mentor details will be provided with certificates. 
4. The selected teams will be given a chance to present their projects through an online platform to the judging panel. 
5. Once the team finalization is done along with their abstract, there will be no more changes with their membership and the mentor details. 
6. Coordination and teamwork must be taken care of by the team leader. Further details regarding the platform and logistics will be updated to you all soon.

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level

1. Call for Abstracts: April 15, 2021 
2. Last Date for Abstract Submission: May 15, 2021 
3. Notification of Acceptance: June 1, 2021 
4. Registration to the finals: August 15, 2021
Registration Fee for the final round: To be Updated
1. Prize Money will be announce later. \n2. Certificates will be provided for the participants
Gear up to listen to the ocean of knowledge. The speakers will nourish with their experiences.
Get in touch with professionals from all walks of life and build good relationships.
This is the best place to showcase your innovations and get the right results out of it to move ahead.
You get to participate in the phenomenal event with experienced people nailing it the best.
You get a good reach for your innovations and everyone will get valuable certificates.
Being part of a YESIST12 you get to connect with like minded people, geographically to collaborate and grow.

Ambitious sophomore pursuing B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering at Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore. Skilled in Java, Kotlin, C++, Python. In the past two years, I have learned new technologies and have built multiple projects. Been into Android App Development for more than 1.5 years. Have a strong eye for detail and skilled with working as a team. Competitive Programmer with high problem solving skills.

Experienced Board Member with a demonstrated history of working in the civic and social organization industry. Skilled in Python (Programming Language), C++, Data Science, English, and Java. Team spirited and has worked on several projects under android app development as well as participated in various hackathons thus having an insight of various fields like AI, ML, NLP, Google services, AWS and more. Strong business development professional with a Bachelor of Technology - BTech focused in Computer Science specialization Data Science from Vellore Institute of Technology.

Samriddhi is a sophomore pursuing her B.Tech from VIT, Vellore. She is a self-motivated tech-enthusiast who loves to learn about various technologies and implement them to create solutions to real-world problems. She is a core-committee member of IEEE Computer Society VIT and aims to bring the best out of her by connecting with like-minded people, working on innovative projects, and learning new technologies.\nApart from IEEE, she has been an active tech member for other non-profit organizations like Skillship. Besides work, she loves to write comic sets and stand-ups, singing and have great managerial skills.

Rupam is a third year student, doing his graduation from VIT, Vellore. A total tech enthusiast, Rupam has designed the entire UI/UX of this app single handedly. He is an established IOS developer and is fond of coding. He is also into graphic designing field. This is his initial stage of volunteering experience which he would love to turn into a long journey.

Aayushi is a 3rd year undergrad pursuing her B. Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from Vellore Institute of Technology, Vellore. She has been an active IEEE-CS member since the past 2 and a half years and is currently serving as the Vice - Chairperson of her student branch. She got connected to with IEEE after she represented her student branch in the Chapter Representation competition at AICSSYC \'19 and bagged the title for the most outstanding Student Chapter’ 19. Since then, there has been no looking back. She has actively contributed in developing the Android Application for IEEE YESIST12 2020 too and served as a student mentor during IEEE WIE Project Based Learning School Camp. She enjoys taking up challenges and believes that only challenges help a person grow.

Dr Ramalatha Marimuthu has been in teaching for over 30 years and has a vast experience in motivating and training the students on skill development and peer networking. She organises leadership training workshops. conferences and congresses for training student leaders and for encouraging entrepreneurship which has resulted in many student startups. 
"She also guides the students in developing unique solutions for social problems like inclusiveness and accessibility in day to day life for people with special needs. She has received many awards from IEEE, Lions Club, Government of Tamilnadu India and Anita Borg Institute for Women and Technology, California for effecting positive changes in community through technology. 
"She has delivered lectures on assistive technology in universities and conferences all over the world and in Google. 
"Mountainview and Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, Richland. Her areas of interest are assistive technology women empowerment and effective education With her years of teaching experience she has introduced many novelties in teaching and assessment methods and learnt from the results. Strategic Planning Developing infrastructure, administration and people management are some of her interests. Being a positive person which is one of her greatest strength. She has developed herself in studying the human nature and identifying best people for the activities. This has given her a vast network of people with varying skills who trust in her ability to mentor and guide them. She is particularly interested in encouraging students and youngsters and helping them solve problems of academic and personal nature."

Nikitha is an electronics engineer who is currently working as a Business Technology Analyst at Deloitte US-India. A Philomath with a strong inclination to all things \'Tech\', she believes that the ocean of knowledge is never ceasing to be explored, promising those who take up the journey immense treasures and opportunities to grow and upgrade themselves. She is immensely passionate about volunteering and strongly advocates for gender equity among STEM domains. \nShe finds great inspiration in people and credits IEEE for blessing her with opportunities that honed her team management and organizing skills. Under IEEE, she is a Young Professional and an Exe-Com member for TEMS Society Hyderabad section chapter. She was also a former content volunteer at IEEE WIE ILS 2020 and IEEE Data Science Bootcamp 1.0 under IEEE SSIT Madras Section Chapter, a PES Zero Hunger Day ambassador, an IEEE madC and IEEE Day ambassador as well as a student volunteer for AHCSSC 2019 and 2020. Apart from IEEE, she has been an active volunteer for other non-profit organizations like We For You and Youth For Seva. When away from work, she loves to read books, enhance her culinary skills or experiment with various craft and lettering styles.

Dev is an Electrical and Electronic Engineer who works at Brantel Lanka (PVT) Limited, Sri Lanka. He has completed Bachelor’s degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering at University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka and currently he is following his Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering in University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka.
 Dev is an IEEE VoLT (Volunteer Leadership Training) graduate in 2020 who is holding IEEE technical society memberships in IEEE PES, IEEE IAS and IEEE PELS. His volunteering extremities were lying when leading as the Committee Member of IEEE YESIST 12 Maker Fair consecutively in 2019 and 2020. He is the founder and former chair of IEEE PES Student Branch Chapter, University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka. 
His vast experiences were remarked with volunteering in “International Conference on Information and Automation for Sustainability 2018, Sri Lanka”, “IEEE R10 Humanitarian Technology Conference 2018, Sri Lanka” and again in 2019, Indonesia. 
Moreover, Dev has volunteered as the Country Representative (Sri Lanka) of IEEE PES Day 2020 as well as in 2021. He showed off his talent and excellency in leading the IEEE Day 2020 as the Regional Lead of Region 10 (SL, BD, IN, PK). This guy is giving his best as the Lead Ambassador in IEEE Collabratec and IEEE Brand Ambassador for past years while grabbing the international recognition. At the moment Dev is the Country Representative of IEEE PES CSAC (Chapters Student Activity Committee) 2021. As well as he works as the Editor in IEEE PELS Sri Lanka Chapter, Committee Member in IEEE PES Sri Lanka Chapter and Vice Chairman of IEEE IAS Sri Lanka chapter. He is truly a remarkable individual of dedication and excellency on the platform of IEEE

Ramneek is a Computer Science Engineer and Proactive Volunteer at numerous organizations namely IEEE, Youth for Sustainability, Atal Innovation Mission (NITI Aayog, Govt. of India), Human Circle (Young India Challenge). He is an IEEE Young Professional who is working currently in Amazon Inc. \nHe is holding responsibilities of IEEE Impact Creator, Program Co-Lead of IEEE Computer Society Student Leadership Program under IEEE Computer Society SYP Committee, Co-Chair of WePOWER Track at IEEE YESIST12-2021, Author at IEEE USA E-Books, Member of “Universal Access to Technology” Technical Committee of IEEE SSIT, Member of IEEE SA Industry Connect Program on “Intelligent Transportation System Testbed Development for Dynamic Road Traffic Management and Control at Electronics-City, Bangalore, India” and IEEE Brand Ambassador. \nHe had volunteered and contributed as Mentor to 4 Teams in IEEE Xtreme Programming Contest 14.0, Chair of Technical Committee at IEEE WIE ILS 2020, Co-Chair of IEEE Data Science Bootcamp 1.0 under IEEE SSIT Madras Section Chapter, Project Development Committee Member at IEEE Smart Village US, Advisor of Innovation Challenge Track at IEEE YESIST12-2020, Web Developer at TEDx AIACTR Delhi India and Chairperson and Webmaster of IEEE HMR Institute of Technology and Management New Delhi India. With the curiosity to learn new things, he had deep-dived into research world as well, his research interests include Edge Computing and emerging Technologies. He had published around 15+ Research papers in IEEE Sponsored Conferences, Elsevier/Springer Journals and he holds 1 patent which was the motivation from his 3rd Year Research Project. With holding hands on volunteering and leadership positions, he had been awarded with numerous titles including Best Support Person by his previous employer, Dr. JK Pal Award by IEEE Delhi Section, Technocrat by his Graduation Institute in his 1st Year of Study and numerous technical exhibitions and conferences awards during his course of graduation.

Ms. Indhumathi Gunasekaran is an Associate Software Engineer at Accenture, India. She holds her bachelors in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Panimalar Institute of Technology, Chennai, India. She is currently serving in the roles of Regional Student ambassador of R10, Co-chair of IEEE YESIST12 (Special Track), Member of PELS Students Sub-committee, Member of PELS Women in Engineering, Founding Chair of Nuclear and Plasma Sciences society and IEEE Brand Ambassador. She served as the Section lead of IEEEXtreme 14.0,Publicity and Promotions Lead of IEEE WIE International Leadership Summit 2020, Student Chapter Ambassador of Power and Energy Society, Chairperson of Computer Society chapter of IEEE Panimalar Institute of Technology Student Branch and Vice-Chairperson of IEEE PIT SB. Indhumathi was previously the IEEE Student Branch Secretary and Chairperson of Women in Engineering AG of the Student Branch. 
Indhu has won IEEE Women in Engineering Inspiring Student Member Award (2020) for her distinguished leadership and outstanding contributions as a volunteer, at the Section and Regional levels, serving the IEEE and IEEE Women in Engineering for the benefit of its members and the engineering profession; IEEE CS Richard E Merwin Scholarship for her outstanding leadership as a Student Volunteer; IEEE CS Upsilon Pi Epsilon Scholarship and Grace Hopper Celebration India Scholarship in recognition of her outstanding academic and professional accomplishments. 
Acknowledging her achievements she has been awarded as the ""Outstanding Student Award 2020"" , ""EMERGING STUDENT VOLUNTEER” award for the year 2018 and ""The Best Student of the Year 2018"" by ISTE TN Section level in their 18th Annual Convention. Not just in IEEE but she has also proved herself in academics with outstanding performance. She secured the first rank in her department during the university examinations for several academic years. She has been an active participant, volunteer and has coordinated and organized many co-curricular and extracurricular activities. She has been and will always be a source of inspiration for upcoming minds. 
She has a been a kind person in helping new minds for their development. In her spare time, she founded and served as organizing secretary for She-the coder and initiated several school education program. Her determination and courage has made her to do many achievements making her as remarkable person.

Dr. Aishwarya Bandla heads the Translational Core at The N.1 Institute for Health and is a Senior Research Fellow at the National University of Singapore (NUS). A multidisciplinary team of scientists and clinicians, her research group focuses on wearable bioengineering solutions for disease prevention in the oncology and neurology spectrum. Dr. Bandla holds a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering from NUS, has published her research in high impact peer-reviewed journals and has won several international research conference presentation awards. She represented NUS in the Global Young Scientist’s Summit 2018, a multi-disciplinary platform for conversations on science and research, technology innovation and society, and solutions to global challenges. Aishwarya was also recently featured in the inaugural Singapore’s 100 Women in Tech list 2020, which celebrates women who have made significant contributions to tech in Singapore and for their ability to influence, inspire and impact on community and industry. She was also featured in GovInsider’s Global 50 women in Govtech story. \nAishwarya, an IEEE senior member, chairs the Professional Activities Committee as part of the IEEE Singapore Section and is the immediate past chair of Women in Engineering Singapore. She is also part of the executive committee of the IEEE Region 10 Women in Engineering and the Engineering in Medicine and Biology chapter Singapore. As a circle leader in the Lean In Singapore community, Aishwarya is passionate about motivating professionals to “pay it forward” by mentoring peers and young people.

Janani Ramachandran is a Fellow at Teach For India. She has been an active volunteer for the past 4 years and has volunteered in several events across regions. She has held various leadership roles in IEEE, IEEE CS, IEEE Photonics Society. For her exemplary contributions in academics and volunteering, she was awarded Shri Prahalad P Chabbria "Best Outgoing Student Award" for the year 2020. Due to her extraordinary volunteering contributions, she was awarded the Richard E Merwin Scholarship 2019 by IEEE Computer Society and she is the recipient of the prestigious Grace Hopper Celebration India Scholarship for the year 2019. Her innovative project has bagged the Student Project Funding 2020 by IEEE Madras Section.

Bharathi Ramesh is a third-year undergraduate student from Jeppiaar Engineering College. She has volunteered as a content writer in WIE ILS 2020 and many other events. She has taken responsibilities as Vice-chairperson of the PES society and is currently volunteering as the Chairperson of the WIE affinity group in her college . Other than IEEE she has been volunteering in NSS, Rotaract and Tamil Mandram of her college.

Darwin Jose Raju is an IEEE Senior Member, Associate Professor and the Head of the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering in St. Xavier’s Catholic College of Engineering, Tamil Nadu, India. He is an active volunteer of IEEE Madras Section. In addition to being the SIGHT Operations Committee Chair, he is also Chair of IEEE Education Society-Madras Section and Coordinator of IEEE StB 62851- St. Xavier’s Catholic College of Engineering. 
Dr. Raju received his Bachelors in Electrical and Electronics Engineering and Masters in Applied Electronics from the Hindustan College of Engineering, Chennai. He completed an MBA from Tamil Nadu Open University and a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Anna University, Chennai. Now, with more than 20 years of teaching experience, he continues teaching undergraduate and post-graduate classes in various subjects. He has knowledge about Electrical design in MEP services. Under his guidance, many of his students became IEEE members and have been awarded numerous scholarships and awards from IEEE Societies and IEEE WIE. 
For his service as an IEEE volunteer, Dr. Raju was elevated to a Senior Member of IEEE and awarded the “Outstanding Student Branch Counselor” award in 2009. He received the IEEE MGA Leadership Award in 2012, as one of the three global recipients. 
An enthusiastic volunteer with remarkable contributions and achievements, Dr. Raju works for the goodness of society and the student community and believes that success is the joy of self-satisfaction.

Mr. Junaid is Director at GlobalCast Technical Solutions Pakistan. He has vast experience of Broadcast TV Integrations over IP and Satellite. He has been working in Pakistan\'s largest TV networks such as Business Recorder (Aaj TV) and GNN-HD TV (formerly CNBC Pakistan). \nWith regards to IEEE, Junaid has been volunteering with IEEE since 2012. Currently he is member IEEE Professional Activities Committee Region 10 as well as Co-Chair MakerFair Track for yesist12 this year.

Pooja Sharma K is currently working as a Component Engineer at Flex Pvt Ltd India. She was the Secretary of the IEEE YESIST 12 (YOUTH ENDEAVOURS FOR SOCIAL INNOVATION USING SUSTAINABLE TECHNOLOGY) (formerly SS12) 2020 and Co- Chair for IC track 2020. Presently she is the Co-Chair for the Junior Einstein Track of YESIST12- 2021. Recently she has been appointed as the Executive Committee Member of IEEE Region 10 Women In Engineering for the year 2021-2022. She is the present Executive Committee Member of IEEE Madras YP and also the Secretary for IEEE Madras WIE. She is the one of the Initiative Leads of IEEE Computer Society Job Fair – India. She is the most enthusiastic volunteer of IEEE Computer Society and Women In Engineering. She has won “Richard E. Merwin Scholarship” from IEEE Computer Society, “Grace Hopper Celebration India Scholarship” from Women in Computing, produced by AnitaB.org and “Google and Udacity Scholarship”. \nShe has been the Program Committee Member of many events of IEEE CS and WIE. She has started many IEEE Chapters in her Student Branch as well as helped other chapters too. She had been selected as the IEEE WIE Representative from Madras Section for R10- SYWL Congress 2018. She was the Networking session coordinator for R10- SYWL CONGRESS 2020. She has also served as a Social Media Coordinator and Initiative Lead at Public Visibility of IEEE Computer Society India – SAC. \nShe is an inspiration to many young women. She always motivates everyone towards following their passion. She is a good leader as well as team player who always loves to work in a fast-moving environment. Seeing this enthusiasm in her, S.A. Engineering College has awarded her the “Best Outgoing Female Award”. She has also won the first prize in IEEE Madras Section - Students Project Funding which is her Patent. Her area of interest includes Communication Systems.

Ms. Preethy V. Warrier is currently working as a Siting Engineer at Vestas Wind Technology India Pvt. Ltd., Chennai. She is a post graduate in Power and Energy, with experience in wind farm modelling and design of solar photovoltaic systems (utility scale and domestic). Her key responsibilities include data analysis, energy estimation, wind turbine load and power optimization, power curve verification testing (pre sales assessment) and hybrid system design. 
She is a Senior Member of IEEE and Impact Creator at IEEE Transmitter. She is currently serving as the IEEE WIE Special Funding Subcommittee Member, Treasurer at IEEE Madras Section WIE Affinity Group and Co-Chair for the WePOWER Track in IEEE YESIST12. She has also taken several other leadership positions at local, national and international levels. She is a member of the IEEE Power and Energy Society and IEEE PES Women In Power. 
She received IEEE Outstanding Women In Engineering Volunteer Award from IEEE Kerala Section in the Professional Category in 2015 and Student Category in 2012. She was also awarded Certificate of Excellence by the Electrical and Electronics Department of Government Engineering College, Thrissur, Kerala for her overall performance during the period 2009-’13. 
Her areas of interest include Solar and Wind Energy, Grid integration of renewable systems, resource modelling, Smart Grid, and Digitalization in renewable energy.

Dr.Vydeki Vijayakumar is an active IEEE/WIE Volunteer for more than 15 years. She was the Chair of Madras IEEE WIE during 2015-2019 and improved the WIE membership in Madras Section. She acted as the Chair of first ever IEEE WIE International Leadership Summit, held at Chennai, in 2015. Dr.Vydeki is presently working as Associate Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering, VIT Chennai and serves as the IEEE Student Branch Counselor there. She is instrumental in initiating the Women in Engineering SB AG at her campus, in addition to few other society student chapters. She is keen in fulfilling the mission of IEEE, by motivating students to develop technical projects to solve every day issues of common man. She was recognized for her volunteering activities with the “Outstanding IEEE SB Counsellor and Branch Chapter Advisor Award” in the year 2020. Dr.Vydeki has also served as a member in the Projects sub-committee of SIGHT in 2019 and 2020. She has been selected as the member of IEEE HAC MGA Partnerships Committee and Projects Committee for the year 2021.

Arangan Rishikesh T is a pre-final year student from St. Joseph\’s College of Engineering, Chennai. He is currently pursuing his Bachelor\’s in Electrical and Electronics Engineering. 
Arangan Rishikesh T is a budding flutter developer and well-versed WordPress developer. He has 3+ years of experience in Graphic Designing and Video Editing. He is currently serving as the Chairperson of St. Joseph’s College of Engineering IEEE Student Branch Chapter and Website Committee Lead in IEEE PELS SYPS 2021. 
He has also bagged first place in Yaadhum Oorae Global Conclave Hackathon organized by the IEEE YESIST12 Committee under the Southern India Chamber of Commerce and Industry in association with Guidance TN. He served as a video editor for the event, “IEEE smart village Consultation on Serve the Underserved" in Feb 2020. He served as a video editor for the event organized by IEEE VIT TEMS, “IEEE TEMS Industry Forum Madras” in Feb 2020. He along with his SB Webmaster created a website for IEEE Madras Section Young Professionals in May 2020. 
Rather than IEEE, he is also strong in soft skills as well as technical skills. He has done multiple internships and a budding contributor towards Open Source.

Ankayarkanni is an IEEE Member working as Software Engineer in Formcept Technologies and Solutions Pvt. Ltd, Banglore, India. Her volunteering in IEEE SIGHT, IEEE MAS EduSoc Chapter and IEEE StB 62851- St. Xavier’s Catholic College of Engineering is commendable. She has visited schools to disseminate her knowledge to the students and taught the art of craft-making to uneducated women in villages. For her active involvement, outstanding performance and being a real inspiration to other students, she has been recognized with the Honourable Mention of “2018 WIE Inspiring Student Member of the Year” and “2020 IEEE SIGHT Volunteer Award”. She is currently volunteering in different positions for different IEEE Societies and Affinity groups.

Alagumeenaakshi Muthiah received her Ph.D. and M.E. degrees from Anna University, Chennai. She received her B.E. from Madurai Kamaraj University and is currently serving as an Associate Professor in the Department of ECE, Kumaraguru College of Technology, Coimbatore, India. She has a total academic experience of 20 years in the field of Electronics and Communication Engineering. She has published 5 research papers in various International journals and more than thirty five Research and Technical papers in National and International conference proceedings including several articles published in Ieeexplore Digital Library. Her areas of interest include Wireless Sensor Networks, Wireless Communication, Network Security, Image Processing and Signal Processing, Machine Learning, RF and Electromagnetic fields. She has worked in developing standardized Routing algorithms and its security for 6LoWPAN LLN networks, Development of Intrusion Detection System for various attacks in Wireless Sensor Networks. She has guided students in the area of Wireless Sensor Networks, Wireless Communication, Internet of Things (IoT), Environment and Home monitoring and automation. Also she has supported them in developing prototype models for various applications such as agriculture, Industry and home automation, flexible electronics. \nShe has organized two National Level Conferences and five National Level Workshops to enlighten the academic fraternity. She was a Chair in various International and National Conferences. As an active volunteer in IEEE she has involved herself as a chair in Junior Einstein Track in IEEE YESIST12 since 2017. Also as IEEE WIE Execom. member in IEEE Madras Section for the past two years She has organized many events for school students to enhance their STEM concepts through practical learning experience using working models with the support IEEE volunteers and Undergraduate students. Tasnim has long volunteering experiences with IEEE too since her membership in 2012 till today in different executive positions in her student branch, section, as well as IEEE R10. She was the organizing committee member of many national and international seminars, student competitions as well as reputed international conferences within and outside her country. She has also contributed in IEEE Region 10 as a member in the membership development committee (2019-2020) and Women in Engineering Committee (2020). Now, she is the member of the Professional Activities Committee of R10.

"Material is the metaphor.

"
"A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion." "The material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet " "technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic.
" "Surfaces and edges of the material provide visual cues that are grounded in reality. The " "use of familiar tactile attributes helps users quickly understand affordances. Yet the " "flexibility of the material creates new affordances that supercede those in the physical " "world, without breaking the rules of physics.
" "The fundamentals of light, surface, and movement are key to conveying how objects move, " "interact, and exist in space and in relation to each other. Realistic lighting shows " "seams, divides space, and indicates moving parts.

"
"Bold, graphic, intentional.

"
"The foundational elements of print based design typography, grids, space, scale, color, " "and use of imagery guide visual treatments. These elements do far more than please the " "eye. They create hierarchy, meaning, and focus. Deliberate color choices, edge to edge " "imagery, large scale typography, and intentional white space create a bold and graphic " "interface that immerse the user in the experience.
" "An emphasis on user actions makes core functionality immediately apparent and provides " "waypoints for the user.

"
"Motion provides meaning.

"
"Motion respects and reinforces the user as the prime mover. Primary user actions are " "inflection points that initiate motion, transforming the whole design.
" "All action takes place in a single environment. Objects are presented to the user without " "breaking the continuity of experience even as they transform and reorganize.
" "Motion is meaningful and appropriate, serving to focus attention and maintain continuity. " "Feedback is subtle yet clear. Transitions are efﬁcient yet coherent.

"
"3D world.

"
"The material environment is a 3D space, which means all objects have x, y, and z " "dimensions. The z-axis is perpendicularly aligned to the plane of the display, with the " "positive z-axis extending towards the viewer. Every sheet of material occupies a single " "position along the z-axis and has a standard 1dp thickness.
" "On the web, the z-axis is used for layering and not for perspective. The 3D world is " "emulated by manipulating the y-axis.

"
"Light and shadow.

"
"Within the material environment, virtual lights illuminate the scene. Key lights create " "directional shadows, while ambient light creates soft shadows from all angles.
" "Shadows in the material environment are cast by these two light sources. In Android " "development, shadows occur when light sources are blocked by sheets of material at " "various positions along the z-axis. On the web, shadows are depicted by manipulating the " "y-axis only. The following example shows the card with a height of 6dp.

"
"Resting elevation.

"
"All material objects, regardless of size, have a resting elevation, or default elevation " "that does not change. If an object changes elevation, it should return to its resting " "elevation as soon as possible.

"
"Component elevations.

"
"The resting elevation for a component type is consistent across apps (e.g., FAB elevation " "does not vary from 6dp in one app to 16dp in another app).
" "Components may have different resting elevations across platforms, depending on the depth " "of the environment (e.g., TV has a greater depth than mobile or desktop).

"
"Responsive elevation and dynamic elevation offsets.

"
"Some component types have responsive elevation, meaning they change elevation in response " "to user input (e.g., normal, focused, and pressed) or system events. These elevation " "changes are consistently implemented using dynamic elevation offsets.
" "Dynamic elevation offsets are the goal elevation that a component moves towards, relative " "to the component’s resting state. They ensure that elevation changes are consistent " "across actions and component types. For example, all components that lift on press have " "the same elevation change relative to their resting elevation.
" "Once the input event is completed or cancelled, the component will return to its resting " "elevation.

"
"Avoiding elevation interference.

"
"Components with responsive elevations may encounter other components as they move between " "their resting elevations and dynamic elevation offsets. Because material cannot pass " "through other material, components avoid interfering with one another any number of ways, " "whether on a per component basis or using the entire app layout.
" "On a component level, components can move or be removed before they cause interference. " "For example, a floating action button (FAB) can disappear or move off screen before a " "user picks up a card, or it can move if a snackbar appears.
" "On the layout level, design your app layout to minimize opportunities for interference. " "For example, position the FAB to one side of stream of a cards so the FAB won’t interfere " "when a user tries to pick up one of cards.

"
Rather than a computer-based or IoT based theme can participants choose other project ideas?
Yes We welcome and appreciate students from other technology to contribute their ideas as it is not limited to the specific topic.
Can participants do a direct registration?
We request the participating team to register through the Pilots.
How can the participant know about the pilot in their region?
The team without pilots can find the Pilot details which will be posted in the YESIST`12 webpage.
Is there any team member constraints and do we need to demonstrate the project?
A team can comprise a maximum of 4 members and the project are asked to be demonstrated or a video of the working model should be presented.
Are there any restrictions in the topics to be chosen in the Maker Fair Track for the abstract?
No, the teams are free to choose any topic they wish to work on.
Are there any specifications for the team to be formed for the Maker Fair Track?
No, there are no specifications for forming a team.
What is the age limit for the JE track?
How can one participate in JE Track?
There are two ways. You can either participate by Pilots Entry Mode or by Direct Entry Mode.
Any school, institute, organization or IEEE OU can act as a pilot and conduct the preliminary round for the JE track.
Participants can register with any of the pilot institutions and attend the preliminary round.
What is a Direct Entry Mode?

Any student who faces difficulties participating in the pilots round can directly participate in this entry. But there will be internal selections among the no. of abstracts received. \nDirect Entry link: http://bit.ly/CFAJE2021
How to submit an abstract in Direct entry?
Is it necessary to have atleast one female participant in WePOWER Team?
Yes, there should be at least 1 girl in the team. For more details, Refer the Rules and Regulations section in website to understand the complete rules of the WePOWER track.
What are the different topics on which I can share the abstract in WePOWER?

Renewable Energy, Energy Conservation & Management, Energy Auditing, Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution, Flexible AC Transmission Systems (FACTS), IoT in Energy & Smart Grid, Digitalization (AI, ML, Computing) in Renewable Energy and Smart Technologies in Electrical power sector network.
Is working model necessary for the final presentation?
It\'s not necessary to have the working model. Idea proposition is also considered. However thorough literature study, technical depth and practical implications are a must to support your arguments.
Does my project have to be completely finished, or could this include portions of the project being completed?
During submission, the project could be in an ideation level or partially implemented. It is preferred to have a completed project during the finals.
Can previous winners submit again if they fit into the time frame?
Yes, previous winners can also submit again if the abstract is new and will follow the rules as mentioned in the rule book provided in the YESIST\'12 Special Track website.
Can I Submit multiple abstracts for the same topic / under different topics?
Yes, One team is allowed to submit multiple abstracts under the same or different topics only when the abstracts provided by you looks unique.
Is this competition open for international applicants?
Yes, every people around the world can participate in the competition. Do check the rules from our official website to get to know about the competition.
I want to win this competition, what can I do?

Decide your problem statement in accordance with the theme of the competition. Analyze similar products and come up with a MVP(Most Valuable Point). Also, think of ideas that will be really useful to the stakeholders in context. Choose the features you are planning to implement wisely. Think of ways you can shape your raw ideas for the benefit of yourself/society. Last but not least presentation skills also matter. Have confidence in your idea and let that exude in your final presentations as well.
My question isn’t answered above. Who can I contact for more info?
For inquiries about contest rules or the entry form, please email ieeeyesist12@gmail.com
